Ch1: Introduction

5.Rational Algebra(å…³ç³»ä»£æ•°)

è¡¨Rå’Œè¡¨Sæ˜¯ç›¸å®¹è¡¨ï¼Œå½“ä¸”ä»…å½“ï¼Œ

è¡¨Rå’Œè¡¨Sçš„è¡¨å¤´ç›¸åŒï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”å¯¹åº”çš„åˆ—ä¸­çš„æ•°æ®æ˜¯ç›¸åŒçš„ç±»å‹å’Œç›¸åŒçš„è¯­ä¹‰ã€‚

  3. ä¸¾ä¸ªæ —å­ï¼š

    T1:=(Râˆ©S)T2:=(RâˆªS)T:=T1â€“T2T1 := (R \cap S)\\ T2 := (R \cup S)\\ T := T1 â€“ T2 T1:=(Râˆ©S)T2:=(RâˆªS)T:=T1â€“T2

1) Set-Theoretic Operation

Union,Intersection,Difference,Product
- Example:

RâˆªS,Â Râˆ©S,Â Râˆ’S,Â RÃ—SR\cup S,\ R\cap S,\ R-S,\ R\times S RâˆªS,Â Râˆ©S,Â Râˆ’S,Â RÃ—S

Tips:

- Example:

R[Ai1,...Aik],Â RÂ whereÂ Ai=5,Â RâˆS,Â RÃ·SR[A_{i1},...A_{ik}],\ R\ where\ A_i=5,\ R\infty S,\ R\div S R[Ai1â€‹,...Aikâ€‹],Â RÂ whereÂ Aiâ€‹=5,Â RâˆS,Â RÃ·S

å…³ç³»ä»£æ•°è¿ç®—çš„ä¼˜å…ˆçº§ï¼š

â€¦ SELECT
â€¦ PRODUCT
â€¦ JOIN, DIVIDEBY
â€¦ INTERSECTION
Lowest UNION, DIFFERENCE

3) Complex Query

1. Find cname and city of customers and aname of agents that the customer lives in the same city with agents.

((CÃ—\timesÃ—A) where C.city=A.city)[C.cname,C.city,A.aname]

ç›¸å½“äº

(Câˆ\inftyâˆ A)[C.cname,C.city,A.aname]

2. Find pid, month and qty of order whose customerâ€™s name is â€˜Alliedâ€™.

((CÃ—\timesÃ—O) where C.cid=O.cid and C.cname=â€˜Alliedâ€™)[O.pid,O.month,O.qty]

or

( ( ( (C where cname = â€˜Alliedâ€™) [cid] ) x O ) where C.cid = O.cid ) [ O.pid, O.month, O.qty ]

ç›¸å½“äº

((Câˆ\inftyâˆO)where C.cname=â€˜Alliedâ€™)[O.pid,O.month,O.qty]

3. Find ordno of orders for customer, agent and product combinations that are all in the same city.

( (C [ cid, city ] x A [ aid, city ] x P [ pid, city ] x O)

where C.city = A.city and P.city = A.city and

C.cid = O.cid and A.aid = O.aid and P.pid = O.pid )

[ O.ordno ]

ç›¸å½“äº

(Câˆ\inftyâˆ Oâˆ\inftyâˆ Pâˆ\inftyâˆ A)[O.ordno]



4. Find cid of customers who have a highestÂ discount in all customers.

Step 1: Find all cids of customers

R1 := C[pid]

Step 2: Find cid of customers whose discount less than another customer. Let S := C, then

R2: = ((CxS) where C.discnt<S.discnt)[C.cid]

Step 3: calculate the result of this query by DIFFERENCE operation.

T := R1 - R2

æ³¨æ„ï¼šé™¤æ³•æ³•åˆ™ï¼š

if R = T $ \times $ S, then

4) Native Relational Operation

Questions:

1. Get cids of customers who orderÂ  productsÂ  p01 ?

(O where pid=â€˜p01â€™) [ cid ]

2. Get cids of customers who orderÂ  productsÂ  p01 and p02 ?

3. Get cnames of customers who order all products ?

1.Why must project PRODUCTS on pid ?

  • columns of divisor must be subset of columns of dividend.

Why must project ORDERS on cid,pid?

  • We only try to find the value of the cid in ORDERS of the same for all cid.

Second: get names of customers

T1 := ( ( T ) âˆ\inftyâˆ C ) [cname]

4. Get names of customers who order all products ordered by customer â€˜c006â€™ ?

Step 1: find all products ordered by customer â€˜c006â€™

R1 := (ORDERS where cid = â€˜c006â€™)[pid]

Step 2: find cid of customers who order all products ordered by customer â€˜c006â€™

R2 := ORDERS[cid,pid]Â Ã·\divÃ·R1

R3 := ( R2 âˆ\inftyâˆ C ) [ cname ]

5. Get pid of products ordered through all agents ?

ORDERS [ aid, pid ] Ã·\divÃ· AGENTS [ aid ]

ORDERS [ cid, pid ] Ã·\divÃ· ORDERS [ pid ]

Answer 1:

4. SERIALIZABLE

SERIALIZABLE å«ä¸²è¡ŒåŒ–ï¼Œ ä¸Šé¢ä¸‰ç§éš”ç¦»çº§åˆ«å¯ä»¥è¿›è¡Œ è¯»-è¯» æˆ–è€… è¯»-å†™ã€å†™-è¯»ä¸‰ç§å¹¶å‘æ“ä½œï¼Œè€ŒSERIALIZABLEä¸å…è®¸è¯»-å†™ï¼Œå†™-è¯»çš„å¹¶å‘æ“ä½œã€‚ å¦‚ä¸‹å›¾:

entry.title: DatabaseNotes-Ch3,4
entry.content:
Ch3: Basic SQL Query Language

ä¸€. Setting up the Database

1. SQL Datatype

CHARACTER(n), CHAR(n)ï¼š fixed-length character strings

CHARACTER VARYING(n), CHAR VARYING(n)ï¼švariable-length character strings

NUMERIC(p, s), DECIMAL(p, s), DEC(p, s):

Precision: total number of digits

Scaleï¼šnumber of digits to the right of the decimal point

INTEGER, INT, SMALLINT

FLOAT(p)

REAL

DOUBLE PRECISION


2.Oracle Datatype

Character Datatype

CHAR(n)ï¼šfixed-length character strings(1â‰¤\leqâ‰¤ n $\leq$2000)

VARCHAR(n)ï¼švariable-length character strings(1â‰¤\leqâ‰¤ n â‰¤\leqâ‰¤ 4000)

LONGï¼švariable-length character data(text data) (maximum size 2GB)


NUMBER Datatype

NUMBERï¼šfixed and floating-point numbers

NUMBER(precision, scale)

NUMBER(*, scale)

Precisionï¼štotal number of digits

Scaleï¼šnumber of digits to the right of the decimal point(default value is zero)

Negative Scaleï¼šrounds the actual data to the specified number of places to the left of the decimal point


3.SQL Statement

1) SQL statements for table creation for CAP database



2) Select Statement

äºŒ. Simple Select Statements

1. Relational Algebraä¸SQLè¯­æ³•å¯¹æ¯”

1. Query in relational algebra :

(R âˆ\inftyâˆCondition_{Condition}Conditionâ€‹S) [A1_11â€‹, A2_22â€‹, â€¦, Am_mmâ€‹]


Query in SQL:


5. Query in relational algebra :

Query in SQL:


6. Query in relational algebra :

(CUSTOMERS) [cid, cname, city, discnt]


Query in SQL:


7. Query in relational algebra :

((C[cid, cname] âˆ\inftyâˆO)âˆ\inftyâˆA) [cname, aname];Â 

((CÂ âˆ\inftyâˆOÂ âˆ\inftyâˆA) where C.cid = O.cid and O.aid = A.aid) [cname, aname]


Query in SQL:


2. Some Examples

1. Display all values of customers in table CUSTOMERS.


2. Retrieve all (cname, aname) pairs where the customer places an order through the agent.


3. Get the names of customers who order at least one product priced at $0.50.


4. Retrieve customers who place orders only through agent a03.

O [cid] - (O where aid <> â€˜a03â€™) [cid]


5. List all pairs of customer cids based in the same city.


3. Table and column alias

Table alias in FROM clause

æ–¹æ³•1ï¼štable_name as alias_name

æ–¹æ³•2ï¼štable_name alias_name

column alias in SELECT clause

column_name as alias_name


4. ALL | DISTINCT

SELECT aid, pid FROM orders ;

SELECT distinct aid, pid FROM orders ;


Find pids of products ordered by at least two customers.


ä¸‰. Subqueries

1. The IN Predicate

1. Retrieve cids of customers who place orders with agents in Duluth or Dallas.


2. Get all information concerning agents based in Duluth or Dallas.


3. Get the names and discounts of all customers who place orders through agents in Duluth or Dallas.


4. Find the names of customers who order product p05.


5. Get cids of customers who place an order through at least one agent who places an order for product p03

T1 := (O where pid = â€˜p03â€™) [aid]

T2 := (T1 $\infty $ O) [cid]


6. Get cids of all customers who have the same discount as any customer in Dallas or Boston.

T1 := (C where city = â€˜Dallasâ€™ or city = â€˜Bostonâ€™) [discnt]

T2Â := (T1Â âˆÂ \inftyÂ âˆÂ Â C) [cid]

æ³¨æ„ï¼šIN æ“ä½œç¬¦å…è®¸æ‚¨åœ¨ WHERE å­å¥ä¸­è§„å®šå¤šä¸ªå€¼ã€‚
